page.title: 13Recreation
page.content: The children play games like football, short-tennis, rounders, cricket and British bull-dog. Many people use their spare time in the spring and summer working at peats. Peat is found on the moors. It is very rich, fertile earth, which was originally forest. This rotted over the centuries and eventually turned into peaty earth. Peat is cut with a tool called a peat-iron. Some people go sailing. There are small interesting islands nearby. Some of them are sanctuaries for seals and birds. Fresh-water fishing is also an interesting hobby. There are many lochs and rivers in Waternish.
